Eagle-eyed Coronation Street fans were left giggling to themselves after noticing a classic phone blunder this evening.

Tonight, poor Liz McDonald was a bit too keen to pick up her mobile to answer a call... despite the fact that it didn't seem to even be switched on.

While standing in the queue at Roy's Rolls, Liz's phone began ringing and she rushed to pick it up.

Retrieving it from her bag and holding it to her ear, viewers noticed that the screen remained dark as she greeted Steve on the other end of the phone: "Buenos diaz son!"

(Image: itv)

However viewers quickly picked up on the awkward moment, with one tweeting: "Phone ringing was it? #Corrie."

While another commented: "Phone not lighting up Liz! #corrie."

The light moment came as relief to many viewers after last week's dark events.

Sinead Tinker tragically died last week after her cervical cancer returned last month.

Husband Daniel was left devastated as he cradled his baby son Bertie by their bed.

In the coming months, Daniel will struggle with his mental health as he tries to deal with losing his wife and looking after Bertie.

Corrie's executive producer Iain MacLeod said: "The story going forward is about loneliness and isolation.

"It's about the Barlow family not knowing to which degree they should wade in and take over and look after Bertie for him or to what degree they should back off."

*Coronation Street airs Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays at 7.30pm and 8.30pm on BBC One
description: Liz was keen to answer a call on Coronation Street tonight, even though her mobile didn't seem to even be switched on
